query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.result: 1 Of new pain it is fitting for me to make verses 2 and give a mother to the twentieth canto 3 of the first song, which is of the drowned.

4 I was already prepared everything 5 to regard in the uncovered depth, 6 which was being soaked with anguishing tears;
7 and I saw people through the round valley 8 coming, silent and weeping, at the step 9 that they make the letane in this world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.result:
10 How the face descended for me into their lowest, 11 marvelously appeared to be overthrown 12 each between the chin and the beginning of the case,
13 because from the kidneys the face had returned, 14 and to come from behind they had to, 15 because the seeing ahead was taken from them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.

Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.result:
19 If God lets you, reader, take fruit 20 of your lesson, now think for yourself 21 how I could keep the face dry,
22 when our image from close 23 I saw so twisted, that the tears of the eyes 24 the buttocks wet for the fool.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”.
query.result:
25 Certainly I was weeping, leaning on one of the rocks 26 of the hard cliff, so that my guard 27 told me: «Even if you are of the other fools?
28 Here lives pity when it is well dead; 29 who is more reckless than he 30 who to divine judgment brings passion?
31 Raise the head, raise, and see to whom 32 the earth opened to the eyes of the Theban; 33 for which they all shouted: “Where rui,
34 Anfïarao? because you leave the war?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.result:
35 And there was not left to ruin in the valley 36 until Minos that each one seizes.
37 Mira that has made chest of the shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 from behind looks and makes a backward lane.

40 See Tiresias, who changed appearance 41 when of male female became, 42 changing himself the limbs all together;
43 and first, then, to answer back it suited 44 the two snakes wrapped, with the rod, 45 that would raise the masculine feathers.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Aronta è quel ch’al ventre li s’atterga, 47 che ne’ monti di Luni, dove ronca 48 lo Carrarese che di sotto alberga,
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.result:
46 Aronta is that which clings to the belly, 47 that in the mountains of Luni, where it rumbles, 48 the Carrarese who dwells below,
49 had among the white marbles the cavern, 50 as its dwelling; where to watch the stars, 51 and the sea was not there the truncated view.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E quella che ricuopre le mammelle, 53 che tu non vedi, con le trecce sciolte, 54 e ha di là ogne pilosa pelle,
55 Manto fu, che cercò per terre molte; 56 poscia si puose là dove nacqu’ io; 57 onde un poco mi piace che m’ascolte.

Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.result: 58 After his father of life went out 59 and the city of Bacchus became a servant, 60 this great time went for the world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.result: 61 Up in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that enclose Lombardy 63 over Tiralli, which has the name Benaco.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.result: 64 Through a thousand springs, I think, and more it is wetted 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennino 66 of the water that in the said lake stagnates

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.result: 67 Place is in the middle there where the Trentino 68 shepherd and that of Brescia and the Veronese 69 could mark, if he made that journey.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 70 Peschiera sits, beautiful and strong armament 71 to confront Brescian and Bergamasque, 72 where the shore around descends more

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.result: 73 There it is necessary that all that falls 74 that which in the bosom of Benaco cannot stay, 75 and makes itself a river down through green pastures.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.result: 76 Soon as the water to run puts co, 77 no longer Benaco, but Mencio is called 78 until Governol, where it falls into the Po.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.

Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.
query.result: 82 Then, passing the raw virgin 83 saw land, in the middle of the swamp, 84 without cultivation and of inhabitants naked.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.result: 85 There, to flee every human consortium, 86 remained with his servants to do his works, 87 and lived, and there left his empty body.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.prompt:

91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.

query.result: 94 Already were his peoples inside more densely, 95 before the Mattia from Casalodi, 96 from Pinamonte deceit would receive.

97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.result: 97 However I assure you that, if you ever hear 98 to originate my land otherwise, 99 the truth deceives no falsehood.

query.prompt:

100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.
query.result: 100 And I: “Master, your arguments 101 are so certain to me and take so my faith, 102 that the others would be spent coals.”

query.prompt:

103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».

109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.result:

109 so that barely remained for the wedges— 110 augur, and gave the point with Calcanta 111 in Aulis to cut the first rope.

query.result: 112 Euripilo had a name, and thus it sings 113 my lofty tragedy in some place: 114 well you know it, you who know it all
